Journal.Title: Clinical infectious diseases : an official publication of the Infectious Diseases Society of America

Article.ArticleTitle: Interleukin-18 is associated with protection against rhinovirus-induced colds and asthma exacerbations.

AbstractText: Rhinoviruses cause the common cold and exacerbations of asthma. Animal models of infection have identified a protective role for interleukin-18 (IL-18). Following experimental rhinovirus infection, we observed increased respiratory symptoms in healthy and asthmatic subjects with low nasal and bronchial IL-18 levels.
